Title: Fire of naphta in the isomerisation plant of a refinery released from a corroded pipe under repair

Reasons.ItemDescription: Substances involved: greater than 5% of quantity in Column 3 of Annex I
Injury to persons: >= 1 fatalities, >= 6 hospitalizing injuries etc.
Immediate damage to the environment (according to Annex VI)

AccidentDescription: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><FONT face=tahoma>At about 11.25am on 31<SUP>st</SUP> October 2007 a fire occurred on the C<SUB>5</SUB>/C<SUB>6</SUB> Isomerisation plant (Unit 35) at the Petroplus Coryton Refinery.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>Approximately 48 tonnes of naphtha was released from an insulated pipe feeding the Dehexaniser fractionating column of Unit 35 and subsequently found a source of ignition.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>The pipe fed into the Dehexaniser column approximately 25 metres above ground.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>Subsequent examination of the failed pipe revealed that significant corrosion underneath the insulation had occurred on the underside of an elbow of the pipe, just before its entry into the Dehexaniser column.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>At the time of the incident Unit 35 had been taken temporarily off-line and its feed by-passed while planned repair work to the control system of the Unit’s Emergency Shutdown System (ESD) was carried out. Whilst attempting to rectify a fault on the logic system, the programmable logic controllers (PLCs) failed totally on two occasions.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>The system was re-set after each failure. However, in between the two failures the flow control valve, FC201, situated between the failed pipe and the Dehexaniser column, and which controls the flow of the Naphtha feed into the column, was manually re-set to 15% open, the normal initial setting for starting up the column.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>This reduction in the valve opening created a greater resistance to sudden product flow and hence a higher pressure pulse in the feed line (although still within the design capability of the pipework) when the second start up occurred.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>It is likely that this increase in pressure found a weakness in the feed line as a result of the corrosion, causing it to rupture and release the naphtha product.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

ADFireMajors.ItemDescription: pool fire (burning pool of liquid, contained or uncontained)
jet flame (burning jet of fluid from orifice)
flash fire (burning vapour cloud, subsonic flame front)
fireball (burning mass rising in air, often after BLEVE)

ADFireInitiating.ItemDescription: pool fire (burning pool of liquid, contained or uncontained)
jet flame (burning jet of fluid from orifice)
flash fire (burning vapour cloud, subsonic flame front)
fireball (burning mass rising in air, often after BLEVE)

ADExplosionMajors.ItemDescription: rapid phase-transition explosion (rapid change of state)
VCE (vapour cloud explosion; supersonic wave front)

ADExplosionInitiating.ItemDescription: rapid phase-transition explosion (rapid change of state)
VCE (vapour cloud explosion; supersonic wave front)

Site_Description: <SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><FONT face=tahoma>The Coryton refinery is a large oil refinery on the River Thames estuary. It was originally commissioned in 1953 and has been operated by several companies over the years. Petroplus acquired the site in June 2007.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN>
Installation_Description: <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><FONT face=tahoma>The incident occurred on the C<SUB>5</SUB>/C<SUB>6</SUB> Isomerisation plant (Unit 35), which was built in 1993. It performs a key process in the refinery strategy to produce high quality product. This Unit comprises the DEHEXANISER system, the PENEX system and the MOLEX system. Their functions are to remove the C<SUB>5</SUB>/C<SUB>6</SUB> hexane fraction from the naphtha feed, which if left in situ would be subsequently converted to undesirable Benzene, and then to isomerise this C<SUB>5</SUB>/C<SUB>6</SUB> fraction to desirable high octane materials.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>

Description: <SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial"><FONT face=tahoma>Extremely flammable Naphtha product - 48 tonnes<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN>
